snippet: When baseball officials last gathered in San Diego for the winter meetings, in 1985, no free agents reached agreements and players claimed collusion, leading to the first of three grievances against owners and an eventual settlement of $280 million.
lead_paragraph: When baseball officials last gathered in San Diego for the winter meetings, in 1985, no free agents reached agreements and players claimed collusion, leading to the first of three grievances against owners and an eventual settlement of $280 million.

headline.main: Winter Meetings Return to San Diego
headline.print_headline: Winter Meetings Return to San Diego
